programmes.show_description: The Eagle's Nest: Investigating the murder of Agent Stannard and the kidnapping of a prominent scientist, the team uncover a sinister plot to bring Adolf Hitler back to life.
The Curious Case of the Countless Clues: Steed aids Sir Arthur Doyle with a case that has provided many clues. Can they determine whether their suspect is sloppy or being framed for murder?
Radar's Report: Radar reports on the comedies and tragedies of a typical 4077th week while Majors Houlihan and Burns try to get Klinger transferred. Hawkeye falls head over heels in love.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
For the Good of the Outfit: Hawkeye and Trapper want the army to admit responsibility for the accidental bombing of a local village, but the army resists accepting responsibility.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Getting on?!: After Henry's recent visit to the doctor's, Matthew decides to do more for older people, and invites a local pensioner to come and stay with them.
Normal People: Jonathan and Mark's next assignment takes them to a halfway house for people who were confined to mental facilities. Although they were released, they have not been treated.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
The Hero: Joe Mason, a Vietnam veteran, tries to get government assistance with expensive dental work, however, because his condition is not related to his military service, he is denied.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Stone Soup: Laura has a heart-to-heart talk with Willie about responsibility and being a good example to younger students. It's a talk Willie takes seriously and ends up saving Laura's life.
The Legacy: A present-day couple buy an antique folding-leaf table with a large 'I' branded on it and are curious to learn about its origins.
Uncle Jed: Charles and Caroline are about to adopt James and Cassandra, until Uncle Jed comes forward demanding custody of the Cooper children.
Second Chance: Hester Sue's ex-husband arrives in Walnut Grove, claiming he has reformed himself by no longer drinking or gambling. But will she give him a second chance?
Days Of Sunshine, Days Of Shadow: Part 1: The marriage between Almonzo and Laura faces a test when he falls seriously ill with pneumonia. Part 1 of 2.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Days Of Sunshine, Days Of Shadow: Part 2: Almonzo's continued negative outlook on life during his recovery from a stroke takes its toll on the Wilder marriage. Part 2 of 2.
A Promise To Keep: Mr Edwards arrives back in Walnut Grove harbouring some disturbing secrets, namely the destruction of his marriage due to alcoholism.
A Faraway Cry: Caroline travels to an influenza-ridden mining camp with Dr Baker after she receives a plea for help from an old friend who is pregnant and desperately ill.
He Was Only Twelve: Part 1: During a trip to Sleepy Eye, James and Albert walk into a bank robbery. James is critically wounded, and the doctor tells James is expected to die. Part 1 of 2.
He Was Only Twelve: Part 2: Charles, unable to deal with the mounting pressure concerning his son's critical condition, becomes verbally abusive to his family and friends. Part 2 of 2.
Times Are Changing: Part 1: Having suffered hard times and wanting to find a better life, the Ingalls family move to the city, selling their land to the Carter family. Part 1 of 2.
Times Are Changing: Part 2: Almanzo's brother Royal reveals he has a serious heart condition and sadly passes away. Jenny blames Laura for his death and feels she can't go on. Part 2 of 2.
A Case of Coincidence: Mystery starring Keith Barron. Inspector Masters has a prime suspect in his sights after four women are found strangled - until a fifth death upends his investigation.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
A Case of Coincidence: Mystery starring Keith Barron. Inspector Masters has a prime suspect in his sights after four women are found strangled - until a fifth death upends his investigation.
Feature-length TV special with Leo McKern. A bored Rumpole living in Florida retirement uses an inquiry from Phyllida as a pretext to re-establish himself back in chambers. (1980)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Feature-length TV special with Leo McKern. A bored Rumpole living in Florida retirement uses an inquiry from Phyllida as a pretext to re-establish himself back in chambers. (1980)
The Real Thing: Henry offers words of advice to Matthew when his girlfriend breaks-up with him because she has feelings for an unknown, older gentleman.
Crimewatch: Henry decides to join the neighbourhood watch after a spate of burglaries in the local area.
Getting on?!: After Henry's recent visit to the doctor's, Matthew decides to do more for older people, and invites a local pensioner to come and stay with them.
Parents' Day: Ronald James, a respected newsman and anti-drug advocate, is shocked to come home and find out that his son has turned him into the police for cocaine addiction.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
A Father's Faith: During their time off, Jonathan and Mark visit an old friend whose livelihood is in jeopardy due to the amount of time he devotes to his comatose son.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
The Fighter: The Walton family befriends a young, Black preacher who wants to earn money for his own church by becoming a professional prizefighter.
The Prophecy: Thinking himself a failure compared to his more successful former classmates, John Walton is apprehensive and irritable as he contemplates his high school class' 25th reunion.
The Boondoggle: When an investigative reporter arrives at Walton Mountain to write a historical guide to the State of Virginia, he uncovers a secret that angers the rest of the community.
The Breakdown: Jason Walton stretches himself to the breaking point by working too hard to prove his self-worth.
The Wingwalker: Death-Defying Bobby Storm, a beautiful, young stuntwoman, offers her dangerously troubled heart to John-Boy Walton.
The Competition: Olivia Walton and her daughter, Erin, must face intense life challenges when forced to give up newfound love relationships.
The Emergence: The Walton children learn that it is not easy having their mother as a substitute teacher, and John-Boy rediscovers a former girlfriend.
The Loss: When a young widow comes to stay in their home, the Walton children learn a hard lesson about how to cope with another person's grief.
The Abdication: John-Boy Walton shares an inner bond with Edward the Eighth, King of England, when he faces the most important professional and personal decision of his life.
The Estrangement: A frightened, young mother seeks refuge in the Walton home when she leaves her husband.
Swashbuckling action with Kevin Costner, Morgan Freeman and Alan Rickman. Robin Hood returns to England to find that the villainous Sheriff of Nottingham plans to seize the throne for himself. (1991)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.

Action adventure with Clive Owen and Morgan Freeman. A medieval warrior emerges from exile to seek vengeance for his noble master, igniting a battle that will decide the fate of the kingdom. (2015)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
